com.newmainsoftech.spray.sprex.web.servlet.config

Class StaticViewResolver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.context.support.ApplicationObjectSupport
      • org.springframework.web.context.support.WebApplicationObjectSupport
        • org.springframework.web.servlet.view.AbstractCachingViewResolver
          • com.newmainsoftech.spray.sprex.web.servlet.config.StaticViewResolver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.springframework.beans.factory.Aware, org.springframework.context.ApplicationContextAware, org.springframework.core.Ordered, org.springframework.web.context.ServletContextAware, org.springframework.web.servlet.ViewResolver

    public class StaticViewResolver
extends org.springframework.web.servlet.view.AbstractCachingViewResolver
implements org.springframework.core.Ordered
    ViewResolver for static view (what do not involve no controller logic.)
    By default, returns StaticViewResolver.StaticResourceView instance as view when adequate.
    Expected to be used with ParameterizableViewController bean what will be automatically utilized behind scene when view controller is added in addViewControllers method of WebMvcConfigurationSupport.

    Precondition:
    • Expected that view name has not been set by calling ViewControllerRegistration.setViewName(String) method in the code flow from addViewControllers method of WebMvcConfigurationSupport. Thereby, the view name being give to this view resolver will be the one yield by RequestToViewNameTranslator (via ParameterizableViewController); means the relative path without leading '/' character (and without file extension.) ex. 'static/image/sample' not '/static/image/sample.jpg'.
      Override createView method if it's not desirable.
    Author:
    Arata.Y

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  StaticViewResolver.StaticResourceView
      View just for static resource.
      This just forwards request to target static resource.

      • getDelegateViewName

        public String getDelegateViewName()
        Retrieve the attribute value of delegation view name being commonly used for each static resource under the same root path being returned by getStaticResourceRootPath() method, in order to avoid instantiation of individual bean for each static resource.
        Returns:
        delegation view name being commonly used for each static resource under the same root path.

      • setAttributes

        public void setAttributes(Properties props)
        Set static attributes from a java.util.Properties object, for all views returned by this resolver.

        This is the most convenient way to set static attributes. Note that static attributes can be overridden by dynamic attributes, if a value with the same name is included in the model.

        Can be populated with a String "value" (parsed via PropertiesEditor) or a "props" element in XML bean definitions.

        See Also:
        org.springframework.beans.propertyeditors.PropertiesEditor, AbstractView.setAttributes(java.util.Properties)

      • setAttributesMap

        public void setAttributesMap(Map<String,?> attributes)
        Set static attributes from a Map, for all views returned by this resolver. This allows to set any kind of attribute values, for example bean references.

        Can be populated with a "map" or "props" element in XML bean definitions.

        Parameters:
        attributes - Map with name Strings as keys and attribute objects as values
        See Also:
        AbstractView.setAttributesMap(java.util.Map<java.lang.String, ?>)

      • getAttributesMap

        public Map<String,Object> getAttributesMap()
        Allow Map access to the static attributes for views returned by this resolver, with the option to add or override specific entries.

        Useful for specifying entries directly, for example via "attributesMap[myKey]". This is particularly useful for adding or overriding entries in child view definitions.

      • buildView

        protected StaticViewResolver.StaticResourceView buildView(String viewName)
                                                   throws Exception
        Creates a new StaticViewResolver.StaticResourceView instance.
        (Lookup for pre-defined View instances is not performed in this method rather is done in resolveViewName method.)
        Parameters:
        viewName - View name to build.
        It's expected to begin with prefix of static resource path what has been set by setStaticResourceRootPath(String) method.
        Returns:
        the View instance
        Throws:
        Exception - when encounters obstacle in instantiating view object.
        See Also:
        loadView(String, java.util.Locale)

      • applyLifecycleMethods

        protected org.springframework.web.servlet.View applyLifecycleMethods(String viewName,
                                                         org.springframework.web.servlet.view.AbstractView view)
        Resister view input as a Spring bean under name of viewName input value.
        This calls the following Spring lifecycle methods via the generic Spring bean factory:
        • ApplicationContextAware.setApplicationContext method
        • InitializingBean.afterPropertiesSet method
        Parameters:
        viewName - Name of view.
        view - View object.
        Returns:
        view as bean.
        See Also:
        ApplicationContextAware.setApplicationContext(org.springframework.context.ApplicationContext), InitializingBean.afterPropertiesSet()

      • loadView

        protected org.springframework.web.servlet.View loadView(String viewName,
                                            Locale locale)
                                                 throws Exception
        Delegates to buildView for creating a new View instance.
        The instantiated View will be registered as a Spring bean.
        Specified by:
        loadView in class org.springframework.web.servlet.view.AbstractCachingViewResolver
        Parameters:
        viewName - the name of the view to retrieve
        Returns:
        the View instance
        Throws:
        Exception - if the view couldn't be resolved
        See Also:
        buildView(String)

      • canHandle

        protected boolean canHandle(String resourceUrlStr,
                Locale locale)
        Indicates whether this ViewResolver can resolve a view for supplied resource URL.
        It checks whether resourceUrl input starts with path for static resources returned by getStaticResourceRootPath() method. (If not, then later it will result eventually as createView method will return null.)
        Parameters:
        resourceUrlStr - Path to a static resource to retrieve.
        Expected to have '/' character as prefix.
        locale - Locale to retrieve the view for.
        It will be ignored in this implementation. If it's not desirable, then override this.
        Returns:
        Indicates whether this resolver applies to the specified view.

      • isRedirectContextRelativeByDefault

        public static boolean isRedirectContextRelativeByDefault()

      • setRedirectContextRelative

        public void setRedirectContextRelative(boolean redirectContextRelative)
        Set whether to interpret a given redirect URL that starts with a slash ("/") as relative to the current ServletContext.
        Default is "true". i.e. as relative to the web application root thereby the context path will be prepended to the URL if it's true.
        Redirect URLs are specified with the "redirect:" prefix. E.g.: ""redirect:"myAction.do"
        See Also:
        RedirectView.setContextRelative(boolean)

      • isRedirectContextRelative

        protected boolean isRedirectContextRelative()
        Return whether to interpret a given redirect URL that starts with a slash ("/") as relative to the current ServletContext, i.e. as relative to the web application root.

      • isRedirectHttp10CompatibleByDefault

        public static final boolean isRedirectHttp10CompatibleByDefault()

      • setRedirectHttp10Compatible

        public void setRedirectHttp10Compatible(boolean redirectHttp10Compatible)
        Set whether redirects should stay compatible with HTTP 1.0 clients.
        When set to true, it will enforce HTTP status code 302 in any case, i.e. delegate to HttpServletResponse.sendRedirect. Turning this off will send HTTP status code 303, which is the correct code for HTTP 1.1 clients, but not understood by HTTP 1.0 clients.
        Many HTTP 1.1 clients treat 302 just like 303, not making any difference. However, some clients depend on 303 when redirecting after a POST request; turn this flag off in such a scenario.
        Redirect URLs are specified with the "redirect:" prefix. E.g.: ""redirect:"myAction.do"
        See Also:
        RedirectView.setHttp10Compatible(boolean), UrlBasedViewResolver.REDIRECT_URL_PREFIX

      • isRedirectHttp10Compatible

        protected boolean isRedirectHttp10Compatible()
        Return whether redirects should stay compatible with HTTP 1.0 clients.

      • getResourceUrl

        protected String getResourceUrl()

      • createView

        protected org.springframework.web.servlet.View createView(String viewName,
                                              Locale locale)
                                                   throws Exception
        Create View when viewName input starts with the prefix of static resource path what has been set by setStaticResourceRootPath method.
        Overridden to process "redirect:" prefix and "forward:" prefix.
        Overrides:
        createView in class org.springframework.web.servlet.view.AbstractCachingViewResolver
        Parameters:
        viewName - The value is expected to have been yield by RequestToViewNameTranslator (via ParameterizableViewController.)
        Meaning that it is expected to be relative path without leading '/' character; ex. 'static/image/sample' not '/static/image/sample.jpg'.
        locale -
        Throws:
        Exception
        See Also:
        RedirectView.setContextRelative(boolean), loadView(java.lang.String, java.util.Locale)
